sn29.11-20:3.1: 11–20 Ten Discourses On How Giving Helps to Become Egg-Born
sn29.11-20:4.1: Seated to one side, that mendicant said to the Buddha:
sn29.11-20:4.2: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the egg-born dragons?”
sn29.11-20:5.1: “Mendicant, it’s when someone does both kinds of deeds by body, speech, and mind.
sn29.11-20:5.3: ‘The egg-born dragons are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’
sn29.11-20:5.5: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the egg-born dragons!’
sn29.11-20:5.19: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the egg-born dragons.
sn29.11-20:5.20: This is the cause, this is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the egg-born dragons.”
